About UTAAC

Utah Center for AAC Excellence

We are a community of people from various backgrounds with an interest in improving AAC adoption in the state of Utah, and around the world.

Cheri Blue
Ph.D. CCC-SLP, AT specialist, school-based
Megan Singleton
CCC-SLP
Brian Whitmer
Parent, developer, advocate, CoughDrop founder
Breeana Loveland
M.S. CCC-SLP, school-based

CCC-SLP, school-based
Julia Pearce
AT Trainer
Marci Mitchell
MEd, CCC-SLP

AAC use is still uncommon enough that many people have never personally met an AAC user, or donâ€™t have any experience or support in interacting with them. Additionally, proficiency of training and supporting AAC use is not evenly-distributed geographically, and some areas still need help moving on from outdated ideas and practices.

We hope that this community of resources can help AAC be more impactful in the lives of Utah residents, by providing access to best practices, research approaches, and engagement and training opportunities.

If you are interested in getting involved in UTAAC, please reach out to us and we can find a spot where your contribution can make a difference for AAC users here in Utah!
